column4: Ok, my ubuntu wont start when i plug a pci card, so, any idea on whats wrong? (Note: the PCI card is a Encore Wireless ENLWI-G2 with a Realtek RTL8185L chipset), Thank you!
does it hose the system when you plug it in after if its booteg?
uhhh, whats hose? sorry, bad english
sorry does the system stop when you plug the pci in after its booted?
if not do an lspci and see if it recognizes it

The system freezes if I plug the PCI card and then boot, the message thats being displayed is Starting Common Unix Printing Service: cupsd...which has nothing to do with the wireless card, but the strange this is that if I unplug the card and then start the computer, the cupsd has no problems :s
humm what kind of wireless card is it
Its an Encore Wirless-g PCI, model ENLWI-G2 with a Realtek RTL8185L chipset
ive read in many pages that the Realtek and this particular card is known to work
have you installed the drivers and hit f2 during boot to see the full post so you can identify the error
no, i havnt...should i try that?
No luck, the same thing, it stopped on Starting Common Unix Printing System: cupsd, what if i disable the cupsd ?
